author: Reuters Editorial
title: Israel's Elbit to buy state-owned IMI Systems for 1.8 bln shekels
text: March 11, 2018 / 12:23 PM / Updated 7 hours ago Israel's Elbit to buy state-owned IMI Systems for 1.8 bln shekels Reuters Staff 1 Min Read JERUSALEM, March 11 (Reuters) - The Israeli government said on Sunday it was selling weapons manufacturer IMI Systems to Elbit Systems for 1.8 billion shekels ($523 million). Elbit may pay an additional 100 million shekels depending on IMI’s performance, Israel’s Finance Ministry said in a statement. Elbit had said in February that talks with the government regarding the acquisition of IMI were ongoing. ($1 = 3.4410 shekels) (Reporting by Ari Rabinovitch, Editing by Tova Cohen)
